engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Conversion of genetic code into a physical protein product through a series of precise steps and calculations, similar to a manufacturing process in engineering.
Translation of genetic code into amino acids using a 'reader' (Ribosome) and 'instructional guides' (tRNA molecules) that interact in a coordinated and geometrically-constrained manner.
A strict mechanism to ensure accurate and controlled protein synthesis, similar to a programming language.
